p: The pH value of the optimized formulation was 6.28±0.01 showing its suitability to be used topically as stated by Martínez et al, who reported that the pH values should be in the range of 4.0–7.0. 28 The KMO nanoemulsion was detected to be O/W nanoemulsions since high conductivity measurements (14,92.00±0.03 µScm −1) were obtained. Conductivity refers to the measurement of the free amount of water and ions in a system; this could therefore investigate the ability of the nanoemulsion to conduct electricity, which in turn would determine if the system formed is an O/W or W/O system. Studies by Korhonen et al have reported that O/W systems possess higher conductivity measurements than W/O systems because the external phase is water. In addition, an O/W nanoemulsion was more favorable in the formulation of cosmeceutical products because it is less greasy and more economical. 29
